page.title: 10COMMINICATIONS IN M.W./SHIPT
page.content: POSTAL SERVICE The area is covered by a small Shiptonthorpe sub-office & mail work office in an attractive Georgian building in M.W. high street. Inward mail from York is sorted & distributed by 2 office staff, 4 fulltime & 5 part-time postmen/women. Deliveries are a.m. daily and parcels come by van from York. Collections are twice daily from the 7 postboxes, once on a Saturday. TELEPHONES The original strowger exchange on Station Rd. built in 1939/40 was extended in 1982 to house TXE2 electronic equipment to be replaced by system X in 1986-92. 2000 subscribers are served in this area. Maintenance is by staff from Hull or York. There are 5 public kiosks in the locality
